comments.text: I don't mind being single. I mind feeling lonely.
comments.author: @scratchybrush

comments.text: I am of the catastrophic variety
comments.author: @Billbeaux

comments.text: I count it a blessing these days. Relationships are a scam in contemporary times.
comments.author: @b5f096e4

comments.text: Hilariously cheerful single woman here. I know that I am enough, and I am the right person and don't need anyone to want me because I love and approve of myself.  I went to a therapist 30+ years ago after a failed relationship devastated me which seems incredible to me now. But my therapist, Molly, told me that I needed to learn to love myself. She suggested I get a dog to do it, and I told her the dog wasn't necessary, that I could do that. And thankfully I have. I've thought of writing this  on the wall in my bedroom--Imagine a woman in love with herself...😊❤
comments.author: @sbrehabaddict

comments.text: I'm in between and I'm working on being in the happy single group. Most days I'm in that group, but there are times, days when I'm not so happy about being single
comments.author: @mikaelah8254

comments.text: I don’t date anymore because woman I like. Need more money than I make
comments.author: @Callmesmitty

comments.text:
Feels impossible to balance.  Can't realistically afford rent or a house mortgage without someone else.  Social media makes you feel lonely even if you're in a relationship.  Travelling solo sucks (unless you use a group like via Gadventures or something, and then hope you get lucky with a good group instead of solo weirdos).  Eating solo sucks.  Cinema alone sucks.  And if we don't have kids, there's less to pay taxes toward your care when you're older.

But being with someone can suck too.  More money spent each month and the pressure that adds.  Constantly needing to think of date ideas.  You end up missing your alone time...even though during that alone time you hate being alone and want someone else.  Ugh.
comments.author: @Dynasty1818

comments.text: Being attractive and single is ok, otherwise it is probably your lack of attraction that means you can not date people that you like. But SOL is too kind to point that out.
comments.author: @LastLinux

comments.text: Woman here. After decades of caring for others, I'm alone now and happier than I have ever been. I don't need a thing from the outside world. I'm not A-lone. I'm lone, like a wolf.  AH-WOOOOOO! IF you are a nice person, you can find company.
comments.author: @FlowerBoots

comments.text: I don't mind being single. I mind feeling lonely.
comments.author: @scratchybrush

comments.text: Just ignore those couples walking hand in hand down the street, while you walk alone.
comments.author: @Emotionally_unavailable_man

comments.text: I think I am somewhere in the middle tbh. I am neither sad nor happy about it.

comments.author: @elderrobin8579

comments.text: I'm in between and I'm working on being in the happy single group. Most days I'm in that group, but there are times, days when I'm not so happy about being single
comments.author: @mikaelah8254

comments.text: Single means no closeness, touch or communication about deeply private matters. It's not as much embarrassment of being single; it's brutal loneliness and having nobody to care for. I guess I fall into the catastrophically single category.
comments.author: @CorNigrum

comments.text:
How many parents out there actually understand and feel for their children? A lot of them want their children to do what they want. Everybody on earth is a separate single individual. Nobody has the right to tell us how we should live and do things, even though that's our parents. 
People need to stop feeling pressured because of their peers, friends, or families, or society. Be single and figure out who you truly are and want to do in your life. Learn and grow yourself. Reflect on yourself. Be a fulfilled human being first.
comments.author: @VN-kbkncb

comments.text:
My parents were kind and loving, yet I'm still a catastrophic single.
Oof
comments.author: @_MC529

comments.text: What is the category for people who feel sort of an opposite: I'm cheerfully single but open to relationship and welcome it when it comes...and it is the acute attention of a man, no matter how kind or loving he is, that dredges up all my shame about existing and the feelings that I haven't earned the right to he here at all.
comments.author: @abbi_ken

comments.text: I am of the catastrophic variety
comments.author: @Billbeaux

comments.text: Lack of right person.. 😢
